content.description: predicting the outcome of a piece of code (2017 Spring, Quest, Question 8,9,10)

p.line: There are some helper blocks for control and sensing of a robot, starting in the bottom center of the grid, facing up.
When calling _CODES_move forward (INPUT)_CODEE_, the robote moves _EMPHS_INPUT_EMPHE_ squares forward in the direction it is facing.
When calling _CODES_rotate left_CODEE_, the robote turns 90 degrees counterclockwise, in-place.
_CODES_can move {left, forward}_CODEE_ would check if there is a free square to the robot's {left, forward} to move onto, if yes, report _EMPHS_true_EMPHE_, otherwise report _EMPHS_false_EMPHE_.
_EMPHS_After 100 iterations_EMPHE_(100 iterations of the forever loop), which of the following statement is true?
The robot continues moving; and it could move into a black (non-free) square if it runs for a long time.
The robot continues moving; but it would never move into a black (non-free) square.
The robot stays in place; and it has moved into a black (non-free) square during the iterations it went through.
The robot stays in place; it didn't, and would never move into a black (non-free) square.

content.hint: try simulate its moves step by step
